answers.answer: I dont have diabetes but have gall stones and am almost 18 weeks pregnant and have a very limited diet.  With me i just have to remember that that one cookie could (and likely will) put me in the hospital for emergency surgery.  It was very very hard but i did pretty good.  Instead of grabbing cookies here and there or dessert i opted for celery amd cucumbers. Boring i know.  I cant have any fat so mashed potatoes made with butter and or milk were out and so was gravy which i love. I just had to remind myself it wont last forever and i am putting the baby first. As mothers we learn to put our children ahead of ourselves and i am just doing that before he or she gets here.  Once this baby and the gallbladder are out and i am able to eat again i am making a huge list of things i am eating! I also have to drink an insane amount of water so that helps me feel full to resist the urge to grab that awesome looking fudge! I also told everyone who tried to give me cookies and sweets that i cant eat them so they could give them to someone else, in a nice way and they understood. Who wants the temptation! Hubby and toddler didnt like it as much!  I wish you the best with everything! It wont last forever!

question: I am 27 weeks into my second pregnancy. I have had diabetes during both. With the holidays that have passed and new years around the corner I'm going insane trying to control myself with the amount of sweets and goodies around. How do you do it? Any go to foods to help you stay sane?
title: pregnant and diabetic. how do you handle the holiday cravings?
